channel.title: [PI] Problem with cache download
channel.description:
Okay, so I'm using Deception as my source. It doesn't have the cache included in the client files. It downloads the cache automatically to the C:\ drive once the client starts, if it doesn't find that you already have the cache in the C:\ drive.
Well, I needed to edit some things in the cache, so I did. Obviously I needed to upload the new cache to a filesharing website, so I did. I used the new links for the cache download, and put them in the files needed in the client. Well, when I tested it to see if it would work, the cmd screen that pops up when you open your client gave me this error :
[Code] BrokenX is loading.. java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\brokenXcache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system ca nnot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:72) at client.startUp(client.java:8460) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5759) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: https://dl -web.dropbox.com/get/brokenXcache.rar?w=8159b93b&dl=1 at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Sou rce) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$6.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getChainedException(Unkno wn Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getInputStream(Unkn own Source) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:109) at Update.<init>(Update.java:27) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4457) at client.startUp(client.java:8470) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5759) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: https://dl-web.dropbox.com/get/brokenXcache.rar?w=8159b93b&dl=1 at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getHeaderField(Unknown So urce) at java.net.URLConnection.getHeaderFieldInt(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLConnection.getContentLength(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getContentLength(Un known Source) at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:104) ... 6 more error
[/code]
All help is appriciated. Rep++ for anyone who helps.

item.title: [PI] Problem with cache download
item.dc:creator: @TimeBroken TimeBroken
item.description:
@TimeBroken wrote:

Okay, so I’m using Deception as my source. It doesn’t have the cache included in the client files. It downloads the cache automatically to the C:\ drive once the client starts, if it doesn’t find that you already have the cache in the C:\ drive.

Well, I needed to edit some things in the cache, so I did. Obviously I needed to upload the new cache to a filesharing website, so I did. I used the new links for the cache download, and put them in the files needed in the client. Well, when I tested it to see if it would work, the cmd screen that pops up when you open your client gave me this error :

BrokenX is loading..
java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\brokenXcache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system ca
nnot find the path specified)

        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)

        at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
        at client.run(client.java:5759)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: https://dl
-web.dropbox.com/get/brokenXcache.rar?w=8159b93b&dl=1

rce)

wn Source)

urce)

own Source)
        at Update.downloadFile(Update.java:109)
        at Update.<init>(Update.java:27)
        at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4457)
        at client.startUp(client.java:8470)
        at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33)
        at client.run(client.java:5759)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL:
 https://dl-web.dropbox.com/get/brokenXcache.rar?w=8159b93b&dl=1
